subject: Self Care
title: Managing Anger Wisely
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Managing Anger Wisely.

hook.text: Venting anger feels great in the moment. Research shows it actually makes you angrier, not calmer.

buildup.text: Anger spikes cortisol and adrenaline. Acting on anger during the spike leads to decisions you'll regret.

discovery.text: The physiological anger response takes about 20 minutes to fully subside. Decisions made before that are compromised.

twist.text: Anger itself isn't bad. It signals injustice or boundary violations. The problem is acting while the spike is active.

climax.text: Feel the anger. Name it. Wait twenty minutes. Then respond from a place of clarity, not combustion.

punchline.text: Anger is information. Wait for clarity before acting.

quiz.question: How long does the physiological anger response take to subside?
